name: Clin T Scrotum
title: Clinical T
notes:
**Note 1:**  T1 for cutaneous squamous cell carcinomas with one or no high-risk features is based on tumor size.  
* If there are no high risk features and tumor size is unknown, assign TX

**Note 2:**   T1 and T2 categories are based on size and high risk features and not depth of invasion or extension.  
* TNM includes a T3 category for head and neck skin primaries only

**Note 3:** Tumor size must be known to assign a value of T1 or T2. You may use a physicianâ€™s statement of the T category if this is the only information in the medical record.
* If the tumor appears to be in the T1 or T2 categories, but no size or category is specified and there are no known high risk features, assign TX

**Note 4:** Assign the appropriate T category (T1, T2) based on the tumor size for the following descriptions

    Adjacent connective tissue excluding skeletal muscle
    Confined to scrotum
    Skeletal muscle
    Subcutaneous tissue
    Underlying cartilage

    Adjacent organs/structures
        Male genital organs
            Epididymis
            Penis
            Prostate
            Spermatic cord
            Testis
    Further contiguous extension
    Other organs and structures in male pelvis
        Bladder
        Rectum
        Urethra

    Confined to scrotum, NOS    
    Localized, NOS

**Note 5:**  In the case of multiple simultaneous tumors, code the tumor with the greatest extension.

**Note 6:**  Skin ulceration does not alter the T category.
rows:
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done: 
    Physician unable to assess T
    Extension cannot be determined 
    Tumor size (TS) unknown for T categories where TS  needed to determine T
Physician assigns cTX, no other information available to determine T

Tumor 2 cm or less in greatest dimension 
WITH less than two-high risk features

Tumor more than 2 cm in greatest dimension OR 
WITH two or more high-risk features
Tumor with direct or perineural invasion of skull base or axial skeleton

Bone:
    Axial or appendicular skeleton

Stated as T4

Primary site/histology not TNM defined
Death certificate only (DCO) case

Clinical classification criteria not met 
Clinical classification criteria met, evaluation done:
    No information about diagnostic workup
    Results not documented in record
Clinical evaluation of primary tumor not done or unknown if done
Tumor first detected on surgical resection (no clinical workup)
Evidence of metastatic disease [(cM1) or (pM1)], no other workup
Only Clinical Stage Group documented (no T, N, or M information available)
